intro: Robinia pseudoacacia f. inermis, commonly known as the smooth-leaved false acacia, is a variant of the black locust tree characterized by its smooth, hairless leaves. It is native to the southeastern United States and thrives in well-drained soils. The plant produces fragrant, yellow pea-like flowers in spring, which are followed by elongated, woody pods. Its leaves are alternate, compound, and typically have 12–20 pairs of oval-shaped leaflets. This form is often cultivated for its ornamental value and hardiness in various climates.
